content.body: About the new static Response.json() which can't be documented in MDN/BCD yet: https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/issues/16613

content.body: foolip: Another possible option is to make a subfeature of `api.Response.json` named `"static"` ‚Äî¬†which is ugly and backwards but at least we wouldn‚Äôt need a separate filename or new subdirectory (and no mass updates of existing data)

content.body: foolip: perhaps you could do something like api.Response$statics.json, but stuffing prototype in all of the existing members would be correct

content.body: It would solve the problem, and would have the benefit that it tells BCD consumers what's static and what's not, but it would be a big change. It's notable that it's not done even for the javascript.* data, even though .prototype. is in the page titles (but not URLs) there, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/groupByToMap for example.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: It would solve the problem, and would have the benefit that it tells BCD consumers what's static and what's not, but it would be a big change. It's notable that it's not done even for the javascript.* data, even though .prototype. is in the page titles (but not URLs) there, see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/groupByToMap for example.
